metadata.description: Quality and contextual standards for validating generated daily team updates.

quality_rules.description: Article maintains an objective AP-style newsroom tone with third-person narration and professional word choice.
quality_rules.prompt: Determine whether the article uses an impartial AP-style tone. Flag if it slips into first-person, fan-perspective enthusiasm, or promotional language.

metadata.suggestion: Rewrite affected sections into a neutral AP-style voice that preserves journalistic objectivity.

quality_rules.description: Article avoids speculation, rumors, betting talk, or unfounded predictions; every claim is grounded in verifiable information from the provided summaries.
quality_rules.prompt: Check the article for speculative language, gambling angles, or conjecture. Mark failure if claims lack support in the summaries or verifiable reporting.

metadata.suggestion: Remove speculative or gambling-focused language and replace it with confirmed information or sourced quotes.

quality_rules.description: Article keeps the spotlight on the requested team; any league-wide context directly supports the team storyline.
quality_rules.prompt: Evaluate whether the article stays focused on the requested team. Fail the rule if large portions discuss other teams or league topics without tying back to the focus team.

metadata.suggestion: Refocus paragraphs to center on the requested team and trim unrelated league commentary.

quality_rules.description: Headline, subheader, and lead paragraph clearly communicate a concrete development from the past few days that matters to the team.
quality_rules.prompt: Review the headline, subheader, and introduction to confirm they highlight a timely development (within the past week) that directly affects the team.

metadata.suggestion: Rework the opening to emphasize a specific, current development that impacts the team this week.

quality_rules.description: Article returns all required JSON fields with substantive prose: headline, sub_header, introduction_paragraph, and a paragraph list with 3-6 fully written entries.
quality_rules.prompt: Ensure every required JSON field contains meaningful prose. Flag failures for placeholders, empty strings, or fewer than three body paragraphs.

metadata.suggestion: Fill missing sections with complete paragraphs and confirm at least three substantive body paragraphs are present.

roster_alignment.description: Players mentioned are active members of the focus team (or their status with the team is clearly explained).

metadata.hint: Cross-check player names against the current roster or note if they recently departed.
metadata.suggestion: Clarify player-team relationships or remove unrelated player mentions.

event_specificity.description: Key events or quotes tie back to the focus team's recent activities such as injuries, transactions, or coach statements.

metadata.hint: Highlight how each event affects the focus team rather than the league at large.
metadata.suggestion: Add explicit links between the reported event and its impact on the team.

roster_updates_confirmed.description: Roster moves, injuries, or depth-chart changes are backed by cited reports or official statements.

metadata.focus: Verify transactions, injuries, and lineup notes against trusted sources.

quote_attribution.description: Quotes include accurate speakers and context drawn from reputable coverage.

metadata.focus: Ensure every quoted statement has an identifiable, appropriate source.
